page.title: 17BRIDGEND OF GLENLIVET
page.content: At Bridgend of Glenlivet there is a picturesque old bridge spanning the River Livet. It consists of a main arch in the manner of old bridges. The bridge is often attributed to General Wade but it is now known to be much older than the road-making period of that famous engineer. Very likely the bridge was built in connection with the Castle of Blairfindy and erected around the 1580's. Recently the bridge has been renovated and a new car-park and picnic site have been constructed so that tourists can view the bridge.
